newsitem.title: UK: Major says UK economy booming.
newsitem.headline: Major says UK economy booming.

text.p: Prime Minister John Major kicked off his campaign for the May 1 election on Tuesday by visiting the south London suburb of Croydon and declaring "the economy is booming, what we have to do is make sure nobody changes it".
Major toured a home improvements store where he was invited by shoppers to sign autographs on lampshades they had just bought.
After a weekend dominated by reports of political sleaze, he told one man jokingly: "I would like to have some light on the real issues."
Major spent about 30 minutes at the store before returning to London on his election battle bus.
The store is the Croydon North constituency, a new seat which according to experts' calculations would have been won by just 160 votes by the Conservatives at the 1992 election.
